meanings.definition: Characterized by the humorous misuse of words, especially by confusion of similar-sounding words.
meanings.sent1: The malapropian comedian had the audience laughing at his mix-up of words.
meanings.sent2: Her malapropian tendencies often led to hilarious misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's malapropian slip of the tongue turned a serious lecture into a comedy show.
meanings.sent4: His malapropian speech was like a jumbled puzzle that amused everyone.
meanings.sent5: The child's malapropian errors in speech made language lessons entertaining and memorable.

meanings.definition: A person who frequently makes malapropisms.
meanings.sent1: She was known as the class malapropian for her constant word mix-ups.
meanings.sent2: The malapropian at the party kept everyone entertained with his unintentional wordplay.
meanings.sent3: The office malapropian always brought laughter to meetings with his linguistic blunders.
meanings.sent4: Being a malapropian, he turned every conversation into a comedy routine.
meanings.sent5: The young malapropian's innocent mistakes in speech charmed everyone around him.
